rent underlying
> > > Implementation. Is there a ready mix available for th=
is purpose?
> >

> > 	http:=
//c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases
>
> I don't think AbstractTestCase help=
s in this case (it's orthogonal to
> the question, actually).
???

The orig=
inal poster wants to run the same set of tests against different 
implement=
ations.

I assume the different implementations are somehow related, e.g. s=
hare a 
common base class or implement a common interface.

From the cited =
web page:
"An Abstract TestCase ... that ensures that ... implementations o=
f the ... 
class behave as expected."

This is not orthogonal, this is exac=
tly what is needed.

> The problem is passing different strategies to the s=
ame test class and
> running your tests on all the different instances of t=
hat class (which
> can therefore not use statics to maintain its state).
I =
don't understand what you mean by the statics and state.
Otherwise this is =
what an abstract test case does.

What am I missing here?

Robert
